techmeme.title: How Apple's extraordinary measures to preserve App Store commissions after the Epic v. Apple trial resulted in a contempt ruling and damaged its credibility (Tripp Mickle/New York Times)
A US judged sentenced an Arizona man to the maximum 10.5 years in prison after his deceased victim gave the court an impact statement via an AI-generated video (David K. Li/NBC News)
Sources: CoreWeave plans to raise ~$1.5B through a high-yield bond offering, aiming to refinance part of its massive liabilities just weeks after its muted IPO (Financial Times)
Appfigures estimates Apple made $10.1B in revenue from US App Store commissions in 2024, up from $4.8B in 2020, $6.7B in 2021, $7.4B in 2022, and $8.8B in 2023 (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
How The Ottawa Hospital reduced clinician burnout using Microsoft's DAX Copilot, which captures conversations with patients via an app and drafts clinical notes (Taryn Plumb/VentureBeat)
